questions.question: What is the purpose of a router in a network?

options.a: To connect devices within a network
options.b: To route data packets between networks
options.c: To store files for a network
options.d: To manage IP addresses

questions.question: What is the difference between a hub and a switch?

options.a: A hub is wireless, a switch is wired
options.b: A hub broadcasts data to all devices, a switch sends data to specific devices
options.c: A hub uses IP addresses, a switch uses MAC addresses
options.d: A hub has fewer ports than a switch

questions.question: What is an IP address?

options.a: A unique identifier for devices on a network
options.b: A network's physical address
options.c: The address of a website
options.d: A protocol for connecting to the internet

questions.question: What is DNS and how does it work?

options.a: Converts domain names to IP addresses
options.b: Connects computers in a network
options.c: Encrypts data during transmission
options.d: Assigns MAC addresses to devices

questions.question: What is a subnet mask?

options.a: A security protocol for networks
options.b: Defines the range of IP addresses in a network
options.c: Translates IP addresses to domain names
options.d: Assigns MAC addresses to devices

questions.question: What is DHCP and how does it work?

options.a: Assigns IP addresses dynamically
options.b: Resolves domain names to IP addresses
options.c: Encrypts network data
options.d: Manages VLAN configurations

questions.question: What is a MAC address?

options.a: A unique hardware identifier for network devices
options.b: A software protocol for IP addressing
options.c: A protocol for wireless networks
options.d: A domain name assigned to a computer

questions.question: What is the role of a gateway in a network?

options.a: To connect different networks
options.b: To provide IP addresses
options.c: To resolve domain names
options.d: To encrypt data

questions.question: What is NAT (Network Address Translation)?

options.a: Converts private IP addresses to public IP addresses
options.b: Manages network traffic encryption
options.c: Distributes IP addresses dynamically
options.d: Routes data packets within a local network

questions.question: What is HTTP and how does it work?

options.a: A protocol for sending emails
options.b: A protocol for transferring web pages
options.c: A protocol for encrypting data
options.d: A protocol for assigning IP addresses

questions.question: What are the 7 layers of the OSI model?

options.a: Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application
options.b: Hardware, Software, Transport, Application, Data Link, Network, Physical
options.c: Physical, Network, Data Link, Presentation, Transport, Application, Security
options.d: Transport, Physical, Network, Data, Security, Session, Presentation

questions.question: What is the difference between IPv4 and IPv6?

options.a: IPv4 uses 64-bit addresses, IPv6 uses 128-bit addresses
options.b: IPv4 uses 32-bit addresses, IPv6 uses 128-bit addresses
options.c: IPv4 supports more devices than IPv6
options.d: IPv4 is for private networks, IPv6 is for public networks

questions.question: What is ARP (Address Resolution Protocol)?

options.a: Resolves MAC addresses to IP addresses
options.b: Resolves IP addresses to MAC addresses
options.c: Encrypts data packets for transmission
options.d: Manages DNS resolutions

questions.question: What is a socket in networking?

options.a: A physical port for connecting devices
options.b: An endpoint for communication between devices
options.c: A hardware interface for networks
options.d: A protocol for IP addressing

questions.question: What is the role of the transport layer in the OSI model?

options.a: Encrypts data for secure transmission
options.b: Routes data packets between networks
options.c: Manages error detection and flow control
options.d: Converts domain names to IP addresses

questions.question: What is the difference between TCP and UDP?

options.a: TCP is faster than UDP
options.b: TCP is connection-oriented, UDP is connectionless
options.c: UDP is more secure than TCP
options.d: TCP is for streaming, UDP is for emails

questions.question: What is the TCP three-way handshake process?

options.a: SYN, SYN-ACK, ACK
options.b: SYN, ACK, SYN-ACK
options.c: ACK, SYN, SYN-ACK
options.d: SYN-ACK, ACK, SYN

questions.question: What is a VLAN and why is it used in networks?

options.a: A virtual network to separate devices logically
options.b: A protocol for dynamic IP assignment
options.c: A method for securing wireless networks
options.d: A standard for encrypting data

questions.question: What is FTP and what are its modes?

options.a: A protocol for file transfers; active and passive modes
options.b: A protocol for dynamic IP assignment; static and dynamic modes
options.c: A protocol for network encryption; secure and non-secure modes
options.d: A protocol for email transfers; POP3 and IMAP modes

questions.question: What is the function of the data link layer?

options.a: Manages physical connections between devices
options.b: Provides error detection and data framing
options.c: Routes data packets between networks
options.d: Encrypts data for secure transmission

questions.question: What is the role of the session layer in the OSI model?

options.a: Manages communication sessions between applications
options.b: Encrypts data for secure transmission
options.c: Handles error detection in data transmission
options.d: Manages routing of data packets

questions.question: What is the difference between a switch and a router in terms of their OSI layer functions?

options.a: Switches operate at Layer 2, routers operate at Layer 3
options.b: Switches operate at Layer 1, routers operate at Layer 3
options.c: Switches operate at Layer 3, routers operate at Layer 2
options.d: Both operate at Layer 2

questions.question: What is SSL/TLS and how does it secure a network?

options.a: A protocol for encrypting data between a client and server
options.b: A method for assigning IP addresses dynamically
options.c: A tool for monitoring network traffic
options.d: A protocol for transferring files securely

questions.question: What is VPN and how does it work?

options.a: A network that uses public internet infrastructure for private communication
options.b: A security tool for managing passwords
options.c: A system for routing traffic within a local area network
options.d: A protocol for transferring web pages securely

questions.question: What is SNMP (Simple Network Management Protocol)?

options.a: A protocol for managing devices on a network
options.b: A method for securing email communication
options.c: A protocol for DNS resolution
options.d: A standard for encrypting network traffic

questions.question: What is the role of DNS in website access?

options.a: Converts domain names to IP addresses
options.b: Ensures secure data transmission
options.c: Routes packets between different networks
options.d: Manages user authentication and access

questions.question: What is the difference between POP3 and IMAP?

options.a: POP3 downloads emails, IMAP allows access to emails without downloading
options.b: POP3 is used for sending emails, IMAP is used for receiving emails
options.c: POP3 encrypts emails, IMAP does not
options.d: POP3 works on secure networks, IMAP works on public networks

questions.question: What is ICMP and how does it function?

options.a: A protocol used for error reporting and diagnostics in networks
options.b: A protocol for encrypting network traffic
options.c: A method for routing data between networks
options.d: A standard for managing network traffic

questions.question: What is the difference between TCP and IP in the TCP/IP model?

options.a: TCP handles data transmission reliability, IP handles addressing and routing
options.b: TCP handles network security, IP handles data transmission
options.c: TCP handles IP addressing, IP handles session management
options.d: TCP handles error checking, IP handles encryption
